issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: mkdir should print the parent directory in the error message when parent directories do not exist

comments.body:
Hi [~xiaochen],

I have submitted the patch. Please review. Thank you.

Thanks [~kgyrtkirk] for creating the jira and [~shwetayakkali] for working on it.

Overall looks good. Review comments:
- I would move the comments into the {{if}} block for clarity
- In the test, we should verify the path in the message is correct. Namely, no 'testChild' (so the test fails before the fix, and passes after)
- Need space around brackets for the line {{if(!createParents){}}

Later I thought it actually makes sense when the shell just returns the parent directory doesn't exist, since we don't want to make too many RPC calls with item.fs.exists().

The user should then try to mkdir the parent or just use -p.

Thank you [~smeng] for your suggestion.

The issue with recursively checking the existence of top parent directory  will have an overhead of many RPC calls. Also, the message indicated is explanatory to the user that there is an issue with the immediate parent directory.
Thank you [~xiaochen] for your review. I have updated the as per your suggestion.

Hi [~xiaochen],

Thanks for you suggestions. I have updated the code as suggested. Please review.

Thanks for revving Shweta. As checked offline, it's not possible to execute the null parent path for mkdir.

We're pretty close. Pending items:
 * There is still 1 unnecessary space change. 
 * "{{-mkdir returned there is No file or directory like testChild}}" still seems a bit unclear to me. Can we change it to "{{-mkdir returned No file or directory but has testChild in the path}}" ?

Thanks for revving Shweta. Looks good.
{{TestHDFSCLI}} is actually failing for me locally, specifically #275 {{mkdir: Test create of directory with no parent and no -p fails}}. The test case is validating the existing behavior, which isn't accurate. We should update the test.

Hi [~xiaochen],

Thank you for pointing out about the failing tests. I have made the changes to the Test Configuration file which fixes this issue. I have added the changes and submitted the patch. Please review. Thank you.

Somehow pre-commit didn't pick this up. Kicked https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-hdfs-Build/24657/ manually.
+1 on latest patch pending jenkins

bq. Kicked https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-hdfs-Build/24657/
Jenkins problem. trying https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-hdfs-Build/24659/ for now
